dfischer.utils

Class AbstractInputFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.AbstractInputFileReader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VarInputFileReader, VarRandomInputFileReader

    public abstract class AbstractInputFileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract basis class for input files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EOF_REOPEN_FILE
      Reopen the file at EOF (value = 1)
      static int EOF_STOP_READ
      Stop reading at EOF (value = 2)

    • Method Detail

      • getNextLine

        public abstract boolean getNextLine()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the next valid var input line and parses the vars of this line. Skips automatically empty or fully commented lines.
        Returns:
        false at EOF if EOF_STOP_READ was set on the constructor parameter eofAction, otherwise returns always true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        EOF_REOPEN_FILE, EOF_STOP_READ

      • getLineVarCount

        public int getLineVarCount()
        Returns the number of vars that can be extracted from the current input line.
        Returns:
        the number of vars that can be extracted from the current input line.
        See Also:
        getNextLine(), getLineVar(int)

      • getLineVar

        public java.lang.String getLineVar(int lineColumn)
                            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Extracts a var from the line. Hint: please note that calling getNextLine() and thereafter this method should be protected by a overlapped synchronized statement. It is also recommended that you create a clone of the result of this method by calling "new String()".
        Parameters:
        lineColumn - number of parsed line column (1..n). Please note that the first line column starts with a value of 1 (one) and not with a value of 0 (zero).
        Returns:
        the extracted var. Throws a RuntimeException if no var with the given line column is available
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException
        See Also:
        getLineVarCount()
